website_summaries.verdict: An outstanding entry-level bow for adults wanting to get into archery without breaking the bank.
pros: Accuracy at 50+ yds., even without the included sight
Draw weight is adjustable downward from 55 lbs
Draw length is also adjustable if a bow press is used
cons: A little heavier than similar sized compound bows
Arrow rest is so-so, but can be replaced
Accessories and setup can be a little daunting for first-timers

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for the money! Solidly built and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Ill tell you what, for the money this thing is really nice. Its powerful and fairly accurate when you sight in and get the hang of it. It is NOT however for kids or the average size woman. Even at the lowest 40lb setting. Its hard to initially pull, I thought my wife could handle it, but not even close at all.... Now I need to buy her a regular long bow... I took off the worthless stock sight and installed a cheap whisper buscuit and circular 3 dot truglow sight, which are cheap here as well. Fixed my initial accuracy issues.
customer_reviews.author: William K. Young

customer_reviews.title: Looks good online but do your research 1st
customer_reviews.text: The string began to tear after the 1st use. Practiced with the bow one full day and had to return it. Tried to buy additional parts at a sporting goods store but was told some accessories don't fit due to proprietary holes on the bow that prevent am aftermarket stability bar from being attached. Looks good online but do your research 1st.
customer_reviews.author: ohyeah24

customer_reviews.title: Solid bow, money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Great bow. Did not include a sight as promised. Strong bow well built. Speedy shipping EXTRA FAST I ordered it and it was at my house one day later. Very cool. I bought a whisper biscuit for it and that helps very much, once I put a sight on it’ll be ready to rock. Contacted the seller about the missing sight and have not heard back yet. Still waiting and hoping though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for a great price!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent bow!!! great power which means it may not be so easy for beginners to shoot but if you've got the muscle its not too difficult. The bow came with a sight which i didn't care for but i didn't buy this for the sight i just bought it for the bow itself and with a new sight i can shoot up to 50 yards effortlessly with minimal practice. Its very lightweight at only 4lbs so its easy to take on long hunts. I highly recommend this bow for anyone looking to take their hunting to the next level for a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Dez

customer_reviews.title: Great, bow. Bad instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Great bow for the price. It's a left handed bow. So, you hold the bow with your right hand and pull the string with your left. (Which will prove difficult, as i'm a righty) The instructions aren't the best at explaining how to put on the string guard and sight. So I'd suggest going to Google. But even then, it's difficult to find info.
customer_reviews.author: Trey&Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Worst packaging ive ever seen or this bow would get better stars. Decent accuracy with the 55 pound bow. Beginners should start at a lower poundage. The instructions it came with aren't helpful, the the screw for the cable gaurd doesn't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Good compound bow, for the price.
customer_reviews.text: First of all I myself have a mathews compound bow, a pse recurve, and my girlfriend also uses a mathews. This is a great bow for the price. I bought this for my cousin and her girlfriend and it was a perfect fit for them. Pretty sure I brought it down to 35 lbs. for them though. It is an old school teardrop system and does come with an old school sight. It all works perfectly fine, though I did upgrade the sight for easier use for my cousin. I would recommend this as a starter bow or something to just have target practice with. I'll update if I take it hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Kaeo

customer_reviews.title: Best for cosplay
customer_reviews.text: This is best used for cosplay. Parts are missing on this bow. Go to your local sportsman store and get a real bow, you’ll see the difference plus you’ll get it customized for you so it’s safer. I made a mistake by buying this and I went to get a real compound bow instead, the difference is astonishing.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but...
customer_reviews.text: I got this today and right away I noticed the box was damaged on the corners. Alright now big deal I take it out and begin to out it together which was difficult because there were no instructions. Again no big deal just looked up a YouTube video explaining it. I get everything put together and then come to the cable guard, I try to put it on and get it seated right. The holes to put the screw in that holds this part in place doesn't line up at all. Not even close. Not sure if this will effect it as I haven't gotten to shoot it yet. Only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Fields

customer_reviews.title: A decent bow
customer_reviews.text: My friend enjoyed it, he's looking forward to using it for target practice. Though if there are a few problems I'd say I had with this. To start off, it would be the lack of a proper set up manual and it's lack of a scope for improved accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Needs better description and packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Description of product does not say what is included in the package. Package arrived only in retail box and was open upon arrival. Pretty sure I did not receive all items included in the package price according to some YouTube videos and had to spend more money buying the missing parts. The bow itself seems well made though.
customer_reviews.author: justinspanish

customer_reviews.title: Good bow sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've used the bow however bought it for my brother in law and hes been using it about every other day since Christmas I wanna say 2 years ago he loves it and its held up pretty well
customer_reviews.author: Tyler P.

customer_reviews.title: IT'S A STEAL!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used. I was surprised to find this was relatively untouched. Maybe the box it was shipped in was used, but the bow itself was pristine! I've shot it a few times now and am thoroughly pleased with the performance. Great starter bow! Pros-Cost effective, simple design, ease of use Cons-NO INSTRUCTIONS for assembly; you'll figure it out, but everybody who has purchased this has said the same, and I feel as if mine is missing some components i.e. cable guide
customer_reviews.author: William Rapier

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bow for an archer on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Loses a star because the box came in really rough condition and the instructions are as vague as humanly possible (fire whoever wrote them). HOWEVER the bow is worth far more than what you're charging, it's tough, it's strong, it's perfect. Came totally undamaged and performed magically, I'd recommend this bow to anyone starting out or who can't justify $400+ on a bow (like myself)
customer_reviews.author: Brad DeBel

customer_reviews.title: Getting there
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice bow. It has a crappy arrow rest and it does come with the sight but that sucks too. Went and bought other replacements for that. It came as 55 lb out of the box, no instructions came with it but i went on their website to get them and they weren't very instructional so i still had to guess what to do and just use the pictures to see how things were placed. Waiting for arrows to come in and I'll try it out this weekend with my daughter, she got a new bow too. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it's a good bow but arrow rest and sights blow.
customer_reviews.text: The actual brand is Man Kung. The bow itself is solid but I recommend upgrading the arrow rest, sights, and maybe add a peep sight right away. The arrow rest is thin cheap plastic which is a safety hazard if it breaks while shooting. The sight pins are made of dull brass that's hard to see. There are no shooting aids to attached to the string. You will have to buy accessories like a peep sight, kisser, etc. I took 1 star away because of the junk arrow rest and barely useable sight pins. The actual bow is a 5 star for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thaing

customer_reviews.title: Best compound bow on amazon
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the bow along with upgrade kit (stabilizer, whisker biscuit, sight and quiver) I set it up without instructions and test fired it...deadly accurate and went straight through my Styrofoam target. Comes with Allen wrenches too. Giving 5 stars because for the price it's a steal but I wish I came with instructions.
customer_reviews.author: chester thomas

customer_reviews.title: most bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bow. I like it. The draw is just a bit short for me (I'm 6'2"), but nothing I've found that hinders my performance. I've been able to snag two turkeys rather easily. While this bow is rather inexpensive, I like it as much as my friends who have purchased $500+-$1,000 for theirs. I will not say this bow is as good/pretty/refined as theirs. However, it does not want for accuracy and has plenty of power. I highly recommend the bow and the seller had it to me very quickly. If I could have a "do-over", I would still purchase this bow. It is by far the best purchase for the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: We've never purchased anything like this before
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves his bow. We've never purchased anything like this before, so I really can't comment on if it's good for hunting or whatever, but he loves to target shoot with it. Arrows are expensive, so if you aren't a bow shooter or never purchased arrows, get ready for sticker shock! Lots of fun, though!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L

customer_reviews.title: It seems like a great bow
customer_reviews.text: This is the first compound bow I have ever owned, and I got it just to target practice. It seems like a great bow. I did order some different sights and arrow rest to make it a little more useful, but overall I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: AMAD

customer_reviews.title: Great first starter bow! Nice!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 16 year old son. They started to shoot archery in high school this year. For his first time, he did really well. So we got this for him as a starter bow. Nice bow!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Moeller

customer_reviews.title: Will need to return the bow - frustrated and disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend, and he was very excited. However, he's unable to use the bow because of missing hardware pieces (specifically, the fastener for the cable guard). Also, there is no manual included in the box. Will need to return the bow - frustrated and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mediagal

customer_reviews.title: This bow is so cool
customer_reviews.text: This bow is so cool. It came 2days earlu & looks better than the pics. It is so easy to use & what little assembly is required is a sinch. Will be buying from this company in the future for sure. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Ive shot bow before but never owned one and i couldnt be happier with my choice as a first bow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bow about a month ago as my first bow after looking and looking for a very long time. They were either to expensive or werent a strong enough bow to hunt with, until i discovered this glorious thing. Ive shot bow before but never owned one and i couldnt be happier with my choice as a first bow. The draw back strength is a little more then i thought but all in all it is an amazing bow. I shoot it about every day and again, i couldnt be happier with my choice for a first owned bow
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone who is a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great for anyone who is a beginner. The attachments that come with the bow aren't that great but once I got my own put on it's been great. Easy to use and get accustomed too. I bought 30" carbon arrows to go with it and they work fine. So far, everything is checking out really well!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla S. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cool bow and it was exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great bow for beginners and experts alike. Great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Ian Page

customer_reviews.title: Great value end up buying another
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bow for the money particularly with SAS ' complay bow sight kit. I liked it so much I bought another for my self
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Head

customer_reviews.title: This bow looks nice, shoots nice
customer_reviews.text: This bow looks nice, shoots nice, and is very strong. Had it for a while and it is still rocking! Definitly would get another one!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Well made, solid, simple
customer_reviews.text: My first bow since the 20# bow I had as a kid decades ago. Did my YouTube research and decided on this. Well made, solid feel. And honestly does not look like a Frankenstein contraption like the new compounds, simple and good power.
customer_reviews.author: dogowner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent balance & very durable. For the price one of the best bows I've ever shot.
customer_reviews.author: AO VA

customer_reviews.title: Its A-OK
customer_reviews.text: Hey , for the price you can't beat it ... Its powerful and accurate . I got a bisque arrow rest and it shoots and feels like the expensive ones . Just a little heavy but you get use to it ... A GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.author: L.Threecrows C.

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line!
customer_reviews.text: This should get 10 stars. My son loves it. Perfect bow and price. We thought about buying high end and found this was rated very highly. I see why it awesome as my son says.
customer_reviews.author: sherry McNamara

customer_reviews.title: bow
customer_reviews.text: for a used bow it looked new I am very happy
customer_reviews.author: frank roberts jr

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners bow
customer_reviews.text: Great bow for target practice and beginners. Just getting back into archery after a long hiatus, this is just what I needed to get me back in the swing. Some the accessories aren't the greatest, but the bow is very solid.
customer_reviews.author: brian jones

customer_reviews.title: works great, lost heaps of arrows in the snow though
customer_reviews.text: Had to adjust the cams because I'm not Strong Man. Otherwise, works great, lost heaps of arrows in the snow though, this bugger flies.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Fidler

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great 1st now, quality is very nice and draw is adjustable
customer_reviews.author: Tom VanSickle

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this purchase. I certainly have to practice more, but this is a nice bow. I didn't need a thousand dollar bow so this is great for practicing. Careful when shooting, make sure to have your arm/elbow out. I had to explain a huge bruise, but that's on me.
customer_reviews.author: James D Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Needs assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: No assembly instructions or pictures. You have to look at the general pic on the box to try and figure out how to assemble the sight and cable guides. The strung is not quality. It's ok at best.
customer_reviews.author: Brody Ellis

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting a used Corolla, got a new Camry.
customer_reviews.text: Very decent bow, it comes with an arrow rest and sights. I think it's good for beginners. I mostly use it to practice in the backyard. Manufacturing quality is on par with the price. If you are looking to start learning a compound bow, this is a good start.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Four

customer_reviews.title: Great bow great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bow. I followed the setup instructions and BAM!!! Works great!!! (Once you tweek it correctly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Antoine Bracy

customer_reviews.title: So awesome! Great quality
customer_reviews.text: So awesome! Great quality. My husband is a beast, and thought it might be flimsy for him. But it's holding up quite nicely. He's loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Healon

customer_reviews.title: I really don't have anything to compare to but I like it. It works and it's lighter then the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bow, I really don't have anything to compare to but I like it. It works and it's lighter then the first bow I used. I've read other reviews of this bow that said it didn't come with the target sheet but mine did.
customer_reviews.author: john t.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this bow even though I have a 27 inch draw I can still use it.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Just started archery and I can hit a bulls eye from 40+ yards on my first shooting session. Now that I have all the frills and it's properly sighted, I expect to be hitting them at 60+. Seems like a great buy to me.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good bow but if u over 21 years old you need more than 55 lb.
customer_reviews.author: Spas

customer_reviews.title: Great Bow!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son he absolutely loves it! I wish it came completely assembled but not hard to assemble he has been using since it arrived....speedy delivery, well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Great bow that can grow with you.
customer_reviews.text: Great bow. It is well made. Finally I have a bow I ciuld afford that I ciuld adjust for my limited ability. I haven't drawn a bi in 30 years because of a brain hemorrhage. This ia a bow that can change as I improve.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Mansell

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never shot a bow. I had to you tube some items as some assembly is required. But after getting it zeroed in... sites are easy to adjust. I am at 90% bullseye at 20 yards. Solid for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Country livin

customer_reviews.title: Love the bow
customer_reviews.text: Love the bow, very stylish and sturdy, but the package came with no instructions for assembly... As a new archer, I don't yet know enough to put one together.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher D. Penland

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: The quality and construction are excellent! I do wish however the instructions did not assume that the purchaser was knowledgeable on how to assemble the bow. It took some time but we did manage to get it put together, and actually shot an arrow with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Needs a lot of parts
customer_reviews.text: Needs a lot of parts, my brother gave me an arrow rest, silencers, stabilizer and I had to get a rear sight, and knocking loop but it shoots good.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Hurst

customer_reviews.title: This bow was a birthday present for my husband and ...
customer_reviews.text: This bow was a birthday present for my husband and he just love's it.it's been awhile since he had one .He had a sixty lb recurve as a kid/teenager.the company selling these ROCKS!!
customer_reviews.author: christa box

customer_reviews.title: Feels like it is good quality
customer_reviews.text: No instructions. Not too hard to figure out, just look up some pictures online. There is a small black screw with out a head, it is important for the cable guard. Feels like it is good quality. Suggest getting wax for the bow string.
customer_reviews.author: bryan

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy this again
customer_reviews.text: Unable to lower the pull lbs. With out it breaking. It says 55lbs. I'm a big guy and put it on a pull scale came I'm close to 100+ pulling lbs. Can not get it any lower than 65lbs!
customer_reviews.author: todd lichtenwalter

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BOW
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bow for my boyfriend and he absolutely loves it! The pull is great, heavy enough for a good amount of power, but not so heavy you tire out on the 5th pull. Great Bow, definitely would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Clohessy

customer_reviews.title: Really nice bow
customer_reviews.text: got mine today VERY well packed and the picture does this bow no justice will be buying another one for myself as this was for my son and I hate compound bows I normally only use recurves

customer_reviews.title: Manual is pretty basic as are the features but for a starter ...
customer_reviews.text: Manual is pretty basic as are the features but for a starter bow for the price it is great. My husband took it to a sporting goods place and had them install add ons. He doesn't use it for hunting, just rec shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Laura murphy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. High quality components
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. High quality components. This is an amazing bow. Bow did not have an owners manual?

customer_reviews.title: Great Bow for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this bow. Easy to shoot and looks great. The 55lb draw is good for older kids and looks and feels substantial.

customer_reviews.title: family time
customer_reviews.text: My kids love the bow and now we are joining an archery club as a family, great product.
customer_reviews.author: mjofivs

customer_reviews.title: Son Loves IT
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bow. It was easy to adjust to his weight and he has been having a great time shooting targets in the yard.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Expect no instructions but it is a great bow for the beginner. You can YouTube the bow and get instructions on how to adjust and place the attachments.

customer_reviews.title: Good bow!
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a really good bow (which is what I was really buying). The reasons it did not get the 5th star were that the accessories were sub standard, which I expected, and also mine was missing the smallest screw used for the cable bar. Otherwise great product and good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Zahir

customer_reviews.title: It is an excellent beginners bow
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent beginners bow. The set up instructions were missing when it arrived but so far the bow has proven to be satisfactory.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet bow if it didn't come to me in pieces I would have loved it!

customer_reviews.title: Nice bow
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this bow years ago and still works like brand new to this day.

customer_reviews.text: My teenager is just learning to shoot and he is a big fan. We had to lower the tension a bit from where is started but he loves it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for me! I just got into Archery, and this bow fits my needs. good quality!

customer_reviews.text: my son in law is going to be so surprised when he sees this Christmas morning. He will love it. Thank you.

customer_reviews.text: Great bow for the price. Can use it as is but comes with very cheap site an arrow rest. Definitely can be used for hunting.

customer_reviews.title: ... dangerous but in the same time it is very good at hunting so if you want to bye it ...
customer_reviews.text: It is very powerful and dangerous but in the same time it is very good at hunting so if you want to bye it do not think believe me it is good at training and hunting and playing

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: The bow turned out to be great. My husband can now shoot with my grandson. It works great and was easy to use.

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for recreational target shooting.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent adult starter bow. I put an upgraded sight and an upgraded knock. Ready to go with plenty of power.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: 1) The cable snapped within 10 minutes. 2) The small plastic piece which holds the cables to the small pole never stayed on, flew off, almost hit me in the face. 3) It vibrates much more than similar bows I've used. Garbage

customer_reviews.title: SAS Siege Comound Bow
customer_reviews.text: Some assembly required and the instructions aren't that good. Excellent entry level bow though!

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Bow
customer_reviews.text: Great bow to practice with and see if you'll even enjoy archery. Well made and shoots true.

customer_reviews.title: a very old style bow. do not buy this ...
customer_reviews.text: a very old style bow. do not buy this bow. you can not replace string or rollers when they break.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does not bring instructions, it assumes you used a Bow before.
customer_reviews.author: E. Celis

customer_reviews.title: Shot an arrow through my bedroom window, and it went through CLEAN
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to see how strong the bow string was, and tested it a little by slightly pulling it back to launch an arrow at one of my targets. Don't underestimate this bows power, a missed my target and it sailed THROUGH my window. It made a hole in my window without damage to the arrow, and without the window shattering. I was worried this bow wouldn't pack enough punch, but now I know this thing is the real deal. (Fair warning, even though it's been said many times before, if you're like me and think you're "in control", indoor testing is a bad idea. No windows, animals, people, etc...)
customer_reviews.author: Cain

customer_reviews.title: Is it left or right handed
customer_reviews.text: The bow I received seems to be a left-handed bow. I really can't figure out if you can select right or left when ordering. I will keep because I my teenage son seems to be a left handed archer.

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level bow
customer_reviews.text: Material is as described. It is a decent, entry level bow. The only issue I've had was the little plastic finger the arrow rests on broke the first time I shot. Go buy a Whisker Biscuit and be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Eck

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great bow for the price. Wonderful first bow for the beginner or someone wanting an upgrade from an older bow.

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, strong sturdy and easy to use I love this bow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bow. would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great Bow. Feels great and looks better. Have mounted a compensator and truglow sights so far. Looks amazing.

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bow for the Price
customer_reviews.text: As a new archer, I am very pleased with this bow. I did replace the arrow rest and the sight and also added a peep sight but I am pleased with the performance for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: I love the bow
customer_reviews.text: I love the bow, but when I went to use the accesories, there wasn't an instruction manual- so heads up, you'll have to figure it out. The bow is great, and seems like a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: The Barista

customer_reviews.title: amazing, beautiful bow
customer_reviews.text: amazing, beautiful bow. it didn't come with instructions and I didn't use the original sights it came with because I purchased an upgrade kit, also available on amazon. That upgrade kit is a must buy with this item and was pretty easy to equip to this bow. I took it to my local bow shop and they shortened the draw length for me (free of charge and took 2 minutes). It shoots beautifully and feels great. I went with the all black because i thought it looks cool and it honestly does, makes me feel like an archer from a movie almost, can't wait to take this bow hunting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adequate intro bow
customer_reviews.text: The bow is fine for the price. The arrow rest is lousy, but you get what you pay for :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: ... and pictures and help me put everything together thanks love my sas compound bow
customer_reviews.text: I want to Thank the guys at Southland archery supply foe helping me put my compound bow together they took the time out to even call me back I even sending me emails and pictures and help me put everything together thanks love my sas compound bow
customer_reviews.author: Cory A.

customer_reviews.title: Good economy bow
customer_reviews.text: If you want a precision bow that's a no brainer in setup then step up and but a high end bow. With a few upgrades (don't use the included sight or arrow rest) it is a perfectly serviceable bow for fun or hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Harper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and good quality. My son loves it and has improved at archery.
customer_reviews.author: Rosana Toro

product_meta.title: Siege SAS 55 lb 29'' Compound Bow w/ 5-Spot Paper Target
product_meta.description:
Do you want to give your shooters the best chance to develop their talents in archery? Then choose SAS Siege 55 lbs 29" Compound Bow Set and give shooters the right gear of high quality and durability. 

This archery bow is among the starter compound bows for sale in the market. The bow features a 41.5” axle to axle, 29” draw length, 206 FPS. This compressed ABS limb spans balance, weight and strength to continue the life of the bow. This compound has a strong piece layered limb used to draw weights up to 55 lbs. Loosening the bolt will decrease the draw weight by 5 pounds & tightening it will increase the weight 5 pounds. The limbs are accommodated in place by the back pivoting limb pockets, a strong connection with rigid tolerances for enhanced accuracy. A curb appeal is given to the bow by the riser. The number of cut outs in the riser provides the compound bow a waffle look. When the string is pulled back, the bow takes 55 lbs of force and it happens prior to the twin cam idlers activate. When the string is released, an arrow is launched at an outstanding speed of 206 feet per second. 

Highlights: 

Compressed ABS Limbs for long life 
Adjustable Bow Sight. 
Right Hand Only. 

Specifications: 

Draw Length: 29" 
Draw Weight: 40-55 lbs 
Axle to Axle: 41.5" 
Let Off: 70% 
Max Speed: 206 FPS 
Recommended Arrow: 30" Carbon and Aluminum arrow recommended 
Net weight: 4 lbs 

Package Contents: 

1 x Compound Bow 
1 x Accurate Sight 
1 x Paper Target 

Warranty: 

This item is fully covered by Southland Archery Supply three year manufacture warranty. Our warranty covers replacement/repair of defective/damaged products only, as determined by our reseller, SAS techs or RMA reps.
feature_bullets: Draw Weight: 40-55 lbs. For Adult only.
Recommended Arrow: 30" Carbon and Aluminum arrow recommended
